Just to make the coding style more consistent, e.g., always access instance fields with `this.`, make a method `static` whenever possible, use `try-with-resource` whenever possible, remove unnecessary `else` block, remove unnecessary type argument for generics, etc.

I think this should be any class that extends `DatasetVersion` instead of just `FileSystemDatasetVersion`. This selection policy does not use any filesystem specific logic to select version. We can use it for hive partition selection as well

@pcadabam I agree, but currently `VersionSelectionPolicy` is tied to `FileSystemDatasetVersion`, we would have to change the interface. I think we should make the change, but its will be backwards-incompatible, so there may be cause for concern.

I'm going to merge this for now, lets address any changes to `VersionSelectionPolicy` in another PR.

@zliu41 Is this something you could review?  It is beginning to be difficult for me to keep all of my PRs up to date and ensure that what we are running doesn't drift too far from upstream gobblin.
@zliu41 Can you please review this?
@sahilTakiar @zliu41 Can you please review this?

@sahilTakiar @ibuenros In theory there are some issues with this PR, but in practice it has been working well in our pre-prod environment for a while.  I use it all the time to connect to different containers via VisualVM, JavaMissionControl, JavaFlightRecorder, and YourKit.  That said, I'm open to any suggestions on how to make this safer so that we don't risk containers failing to start.
@sahilTakiar Does supporting multiple versions of `put` seem to be the last outstanding issue? I would like to get this done, but am losing time to work on it.

@zliu41 yes, in fact I pretty much copied it from `KafkaWorkUnitPacker`. However, the algorithm is slightly different (the Kafka bin packer has bounded number of workunits, this algorithms bounds the total weight of each work unit), so I didn't want to change what the `KafkaWorkUnitPacker` uses.
I can either change kafka bin packing to use this new algorithm, or implement the other algorithm as well, although for the latter, I would prefer to do that in a later PR.
